tool.name: XChem pose scoring
tool.description: - perform pose scoring using deep learning
tool.command: ln -s '$ligands' ligands.sdf && ln -s '$receptor' receptor.pdb && python '$__tool_directory__/xchem_deep_score.py' -i ligands.sdf -r receptor.pdb --mock

param.name: receptor
param.label: Receptor
param.help: Select a receptor (pdb or mol2 format).

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
This tool performs scoring of docked ligand poses using deep learning. It uses the gnina and libmolgrid toolkits to perform the scoring to generate a prediction for how good the pose is.
TODO - describe the methodology better. A paper is/has been submitted.
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Inputs**
1. The protein receptor to dock into as a file in PDB or Mol2 format. 2. A set of ligand poses to score in SDF format.
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Outputs**
An SDF file is produced as output. The binding affinity scores are contained within the SDF file as the XChemDeepScore property. Values range from 0 to 1 with 0 being bad and 1 being good.
